greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by antidiagonals: generalized ordered Bell numbers Bo(r,n).
comment: Also, r times the number of (r+1)-level labeled linear rooted trees with n leaves.
Stirling transform of r^n*n!, i.e. of e.g.f. 1/(1-rx).
Also, Bo(r,s) is ((x*d/dx)^n)(1/(r+1-rx)) evaluated at x=1.
r-th ordered Bell polynomial (A019538) evaluated at n.

Bo(r,n) is the n-th moment of a geometric distribution with probability parameter = 1/(r+1).  Here, geometric distribution is the number of failures prior to the first success. - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Jan 01 2019
link: Paul Barry, Three Études on a sequence transformation pipeline, arXiv:1803.06408 [math.CO], 2018.
P. Blasiak, K. A. Penson and A. I. Solomon, Dobinski-type relations and the log-normal distribution, arXiv:quant-ph/0303030, 2003.
formula: Bo(r, n) = sum(k=0..n, k!*r^k*Stirling2(n, k)) = 1/(r+1) * sum(k=1..inf, k^n*{r/(r+1)}^k), with r>0, n>0.
Recurrence: Bo(r, n) = r * sum( k=1..n, C(n, k)*Bo(r, n-k) ), with Bo(r, 0)=1.
mathematica: Bo[_, 0]=1; Bo[r_, n_] := Bo[r, n] = r Sum[Binomial[n, k] Bo[r, n-k], {k, n}];
Table[Bo[r-n+1, n], {r, 10}, {n, r}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 03 2018 *)
xref: Rows 1-6 are A000670, A004123, A032033, A094417, A094418, A094419. Columns include A014105, A094421. Main diagonal is A094420. Antidiagonal sums are A094422.
results.author: _Ralf Stephan_, May 02 2004
